lexUnit.name: bark.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a dog, fox, or seal) give a bark

sentence.text: Caspar was barking non-stop .
When we heard dogs barking the Corporal 's nerve cracked too .
Somewhere in the distance a dog barked mournfully .
As he hurried downstairs he heard Buddie leave the house and Lady the bulldog barking excitedly in the yard .
Barking ferociously , the big Great Dane rushed from the rear of the house , skidded around the corner and hurled herself at the gate with such force that it creaked under the impact .
Philip willed him not to bark again .
The Great Dane barked once and sank her teeth into the boy 's dangling hand .
Menzies barked fiercely at his butler .
But I left in a hurry because the piglets ' mother did n't approve of a stranger wandering among her brood and she came at me open-mouthed , barking explosively .
( 12 ) So then the farmer asked his cat ( 13 ) to scratch the dog ( 14 ) so the dog would bark loudly ( 15 ) and thereby frighten the donkey into the shed â€¦
Dogs barked and snapped , and we heard the sneak thief running barefoot into a maze of alleyways , bomb sites and derelict hotels .
Von Mansdorf did so , cautiously , and the gun barked as if he had stood on its tail .
They began to bark as she walked the few yards to his front door .
Occasionally one dog would bark in isolation : sometimes two or three more would join it .
Dogs barked in the cold , thin air .
She hears the fox bark
I bark with laughter , arousing rest of family , including Adam who comes down for cornflakes .
She says they bark at all times of day and night .
Magnus and the Alsatian , attracted by the noise , came running over and began leaping up at them and barking in wild excitement , their panting mouths leaving clouds in the chill air .
The dog circled him , barking .
The engine barked , a harsh hacking sound , and they rolled out into the sunshine .
A dog barked , and continued barking .
But , when he gets too close to any dog he growls and barks .
